intro: Onosma bubanii, commonly known as the Balkan everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees. Its leaves are hairy and gray-green in color, adapted to withstand the harsh alpine conditions. Onosma bubanii is often found in rocky soils and is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
